newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dlr closes weaker on active profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dlr closes weaker on active profit taking.

text.p: * Canada's dollar lost some of its recently gained strength on Monday to close at C$1.3425 (US$0.7449) from Friday's close at C$1.3388 (US$0.7470) in active trading, dealers said.
* They said two market players who were taking profits at the International Monetary Market in Chicago fuelled most of the volume.
The currency weakened past a key support level of C$1.3405 (US$0.7459) and approached the next key technical level of C$1.3440 (US$0.7440).
If the Canadian dollar breaks through that level and approaches C$1.3450 (US$0.7435), a raft of stop-loss orders would be triggered, dealers said.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar fell to 1.1171 marks from 1.1275 marks and rose to 82.98 yen from 82.91 yen.
